intro: Bartsia rhinanthoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a small herbaceous plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often arranged in pairs along the stem. Bartsia rhinanthoides is known for its short flowering period, usually in late spring or early summer.
